title: Model
text:
Code
import duckdb
from palmerpenguins import penguins
from pandas import get_dummies
import numpy as np
from sklearn.linear_model import LinearRegression
from sklearn import preprocessing

title: Model
text:
Get Data


Code
con = duckdb.connect('my-db.duckdb')
df = penguins.load_penguins()
con.register('df',df)
# con.execute('CREATE TABLE penguins AS SELECT * FROM df')  # this creates the penguins table, but it's already there
con.close()




Code
df = penguins.load_penguins().dropna()

title: Model
text:
Define Model and Fit


Code
X = get_dummies(df[['bill_length_mm', 'species', 'sex']], drop_first = True)
y = df['body_mass_g']

model = LinearRegression().fit(X, y)

title: Model
text:
Get some information


Code
print(f"R^2 {model.score(X,y)}")
print(f"Intercept {model.intercept_}")
print(f"Columns {X.columns}")
print(f"Coefficients {model.coef_}")


R^2 0.8555368759537614
Intercept 2169.2697209393996
Columns Index(['bill_length_mm', 'species_Chinstrap', 'species_Gentoo', 'sex_male'], dtype='object')
Coefficients [  32.53688677 -298.76553447 1094.86739145  547.36692408]

title: Model
section: turn our model into a Vetiver model and save it to /data/model
text:
turn our model into a Vetiver model and save it to /data/model


Code
import vetiver
from vetiver import vetiver_pin_write
from vetiver import VetiverAPI
from vetiver import prepare_docker
import pins




Code
from vetiver import VetiverModel
v = VetiverModel(model, model_name='penguin_model', prototype_data=X)




Code
b = pins.board_folder('data/model/', allow_pickle_read=True)
vetiver_pin_write(b,v)


Model Cards provide a framework for transparent, responsible reporting. 
 Use the vetiver `.qmd` Quarto template as a place to start, 
 with vetiver.model_card()
Writing pin:
Name: 'penguin_model'
Version: 20240418T020604Z-565d5

title: Model
text:
Generate a {fastAPI} model


Code
import os
app = VetiverAPI(v,check_prototype = True)

#app.run(port = 8080)

vetiver.prepare_docker(b, "penguin_model")

title: Penguins EDA
text:
Code
library(palmerpenguins)
library(dplyr)



Attaching package: 'dplyr'


The following objects are masked from 'package:stats':

    filter, lag


The following objects are masked from 'package:base':

    intersect, setdiff, setequal, union


Code
library(dbplyr)



Attaching package: 'dbplyr'


The following objects are masked from 'package:dplyr':

    ident, sql


Code
library(ggplot2)
library(duckdb)


Loading required package: DBI


Code
library(vctrs)



Attaching package: 'vctrs'


The following object is masked from 'package:dplyr':

    data_frame


Code
library(DBI)




Code
df <- palmerpenguins::penguins
df %>%
  group_by(species, sex) %>%
  summarise(
    across(
      where(is.numeric), 
      \(x) mean(x, na.rm = TRUE)
      ), .groups = "drop"
    ) %>%
  knitr::kable()

title: Penguins EDA
section: Penguin Size vs Mass by Species – plot some stuff
text:
Penguin Size vs Mass by Species – plot some stuff


Code
df %>%
  ggplot(aes(x = bill_length_mm, y = body_mass_g, color = species)) +
  geom_point() + 
  geom_smooth(method = "lm")


`geom_smooth()` using formula = 'y ~ x'


Warning: Removed 2 rows containing non-finite outside the scale range
(`stat_smooth()`).


Warning: Removed 2 rows containing missing values or values outside the scale range
(`geom_point()`).











Code
df %>%
  group_by(species, sex) %>%
  summarise(
    across(
        ends_with("mm") | ends_with("g"),
      \(x) mean(x, na.rm = TRUE)
      ), .groups = "drop"
    ) %>%
  dplyr::collect() %>% 
  knitr::kable()
